title: Tesla and Musk Lose Ruling on Factory Union Issues
description: A court upheld a finding that Tesla wrongly fired a worker involved in labor organizing and that a Twitter post by Elon Musk was illegally anti-union.

title: Fox News Suffers Major Setback in Its Defamation Case
description: The judge said the case would still need to proceed to trial, for a jury to weigh whether Fox News spread false claims about Dominion Voting Systems, and to determine any damages.

title: Sam Altman, the ChatGPT King, Is Pretty Sure It’s All Going to Be OK
description: Sam Altman sees the pros and cons of totally changing the world as we know it. And if he does make human intelligence useless, he has a plan to fix it.

title: ChatGPT Faces Ban in Italy Over Privacy Concerns
description: The action by Italy’s data protection agency is the first known instance of the chatbot being blocked by a Western country.

title: Google C.E.O. Sundar Pichai on the A.I. Moment: ‘You Will See Us Be Bold’
description: In an extended interview, Mr. Pichai expressed both optimism and worry about the state of the A.I. race.

title: A Big Rover Aims to Be Like ‘U.P.S. for the Moon’
description: A small company, Astrolab, announced a deal with SpaceX to send a robotic version of its transport vehicle to the lunar surface and help deploy other company’s payloads.

title: The Future of AI: What Comes Next and What to Expect
description: Where we’re heading tomorrow, next year and beyond.

title: Police Relied on Hidden Technology and Put the Wrong Person in Jail
description: Randal Reid spent nearly a week in confinement, falsely accused of stealing purses in a state he said he had never even visited.

title: Twitter’s Blue Check Apocalypse Is Upon Us. Here’s What to Know.
description: Elon Musk, Twitter’s owner, is changing the platform’s longstanding practice of verifying accounts. That has implications for a range of users.

title: New Rules Will Make Many Electric Cars Ineligible for Tax Credits
description: The Biden administration hopes its guidelines for up to $7,500 in tax credits will encourage automakers to reduce their reliance on China for batteries and raw materials.

title: Has Bitcoin Benefited From the Banking Crisis? Not in the Way Its Fans Hoped.
description: Bitcoin’s price has soared since banks failed this month, but there’s little evidence that the surge is being driven by investors treating the virtual currency as a financial alternative.

title: Google C.E.O. Sundar Pichai on Bard, A.I. ‘Whiplash’ and Competing With ChatGPT
description: “Am I concerned? Yes. Am I optimistic and excited about all the potential of this technology? Incredibly.”
